reviews.review: Really good addition to the series! <3

The Orange Box was the first video game that I ever brought. Best eighty rupees I ever spent.

The highlight of the bundle was Episode 2. Full on intrigue and emotion, E2 took you to a countryside setting full of Xenian wildlife and Combine shenanigans. From Alyx winking to embracing my inner speed demon to making friends with Gnome Chomsky to witnessing D0g reminding everyone who the best good boy is- E2 went over and above its genre-breaking forefathers.

I don't know how they did it, but they did it. Valve broke its own records of craftmanship.
Этот эпизод шикарен, но я чучуть под задалбался выполнять последнию миссию из-за багов с охотниками, а так игра шидовральна, советую всем пройти!
Can't wait to play then next episode!

When compared to the first, this tense continuation is a remarkable improvement in terms of both length and overall consistency. There's a plot not too dragged, and also not too rushed. The final battle with striders and hunters feels underwhelming when hunters can be taken down just by a single crash from the japoley. The cliffhanger ending sets both urgency and a massive impact in fans all over. 7/10 (I need to play HL: Alyx)

Half-Life 2: Episode Two wraps up the 2nd game quite nicely. Most of what I've written for Black Mesa, Half-Life 2 and Half-Life 2 Episode One all apply here. It is clear why people love the Half-Life universe and why they were so up in arms about getting a third game. My only regret is not having VR to experience Half-Life: Alyx. Maybe one day they will make it into a non-VR version.

Highly recommend.

Второй эпизод по традиции начинается там, где закончился первый эпизод - с крушения, где героям благополучно удалось выжить. В этот раз, они должны не только добраться до главного лагеря повстанцев, но и принести им данные, которые определят ход войны. Второй эпизод по структуре и игровому процессу не отличается от первого - все осталось также, без изменений, кроме мест дислокации. Второй эпизод заканчивается на самом интересном месте, но увы трагически. И третий должен был положить конец этой истории, но, то ли от боязни выхода продукта посредственным или же амбиции или желание сделать величайшей игрой, Valve так и не выпустила третий эпизод, о которой теперь слажены разные легенды. Возможно, история получит когда нибудь продолжение, ведь это уже случилось с другими линейками серии спустя 10 лет (Devil May Cry или тот же Vampire The Masquerade: Bloodlines

A weak ending to Half-Life 2. Half-Life 2: Episode Two is the second part of what was meant to be a trilogy of Half-Life 2 episodes after the base game. However, this ended up being the last official Half-Life game until Half-Life: Alyx.

I had very mixed feelings about the base game as there were plenty of flaws but I also liked a lot of elements. Check out my review of the base game here - https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198157453094/recommended/220/. I felt Episode One improved upon things with better level design and some improved mechanics. Episode One focused less on puzzles and present a more consistent action game.

Gordon Freeman and Alyx continue their fight against the Combine forces as they make their way into the forest. The mysterious G-Man still appears to pulling some of the strings.

Episode Two unfortunately brings back the bland physics puzzles. While there were some in Episode One, they were more interesting and didn't slow the pace of the game down all that much. Here, the puzzles are just tedious.

Another huge problem is that the level design is disappointing. The later stages of the base game and Episode One had some fairly enjoyable levels. Episode Two has needlessly long sections. I hated the whole section in the caves as it just goes on forever. We also have the boring turret defence stuff and even the awkward vehicle sections.

[spoiler]The final battle sequence where you're fighting off waves of striders is a total bore.[/spoiler]

While the base game had some environments that looked rather ugly with all the rusty metal everywhere, Episode Two has a different problem. Once you finally escape the caves, you're out in the rural forest areas. While it's nice to get away from the claustrophobic feel of the caves, the forest just looks generic as for the most part, it lacks any real sci-fi aesthetic.

The game looks fine but keep in mind that this came out a few years after the base game and there is no real graphical improvement.

The game controls fairly well but the driving sections are still awkward.

Episode Two just feels like going out with a whimper instead of a bang. This is an underwhelming end to Half-Life 2.

Gameplay: 4.5/10
Graphics: 7.5/10 (for the time)
Controls: 7.5/10
Replay Value: 2/10

[h1] Half-Life 2 - Episode Two: [/h1]

[b] Este é um dos half life mais sentimental do que os outro, uma historias rica em detalhes e super desenvolvida do que a maioria dos jogos de hoje em dia, uma gameplay realmente divertida, tendo 1 inimigo novo que é fantástico, cada capítulo do jogo é bem desenvolvido, com algumas variações que te faz querer mais e mais, os membros da resistência... os vortigaunts  super simpáticos, engraçados e bem desenvolvido, mostrando seus medos e suas ambições, a alyx, eli vance e doctor kleiner, personagens que foram se desenvolvendo ate chegar aqui, sendo bem mais "amigos" do Gordon Freeman, o próprio GMAN, sendo menos misterioso e tendo mais liberdade do que os outros jogos, Half life 2 episode two... a franquia half life no geral é fantástico, sempre inovando e progredindo na area dos games, a franquia half life tem uma estrutura gigante de conteúdo, que foi muito bem explorado, este jogo é incrível, e vai ser mais incrível ser você jogou os anteriores, mas infelizmente eles mataram um dos melhores personagens deste jogo... [/b] [spoiler] Ou sera que não ( ͡o ͜ʖ ͡o) [/spoiler]

[EDIT:] valve eu sei que half life alyx foi incrivel, sim eu sei disso, eu literalmente amei (eu zerei no youtube ksksksks) mas faça logo HALF LIFE 3
